description: Social insects such as ants or bees are among the most numerous and widespread animal groups on Earth. What makes them so successful? And can we learn from them about our own societies? This module explores the ecology and evolution of social insects around the globe. We will learn about the origins of sociality, communication, cooperation, task allocation, and collective decision making. We will also explore the impact that social insects have on their environment, from pollination services to ant agriculture and ecosystem engineering.
title: Social Insect Societies
prerequisite: YCC1122 Quantitative Reasoning or with the permission of the instructor.
